commits.subject: fix(resilience): add DB error handling to all views, remove phantom dep, deduplicate period logic
commits.body:
All IndexedDB operations across 10 views now have try/catch with
user-friendly error banners. Previously, if IndexedDB failed (quota
exceeded, corruption, private browsing restrictions), users saw no
feedback at all — loading spinners hung or actions silently failed.

- Removed `date-fns` from package.json (listed but never imported)
- Extracted `resolveBudgetPeriod()` in projection.ts to eliminate
  identical 6-line period resolution duplicated in 3 files
- Added silent error handling to useCategoryAutocomplete (non-critical)

Tags: error-handling, indexeddb, resilience, cleanup, deduplication
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: code-quality
Semver: patch

commits.subject: feat(pwa,debug): split PWA composables, add install instructions, add debug system
commits.body:
PWA:
- Replace monolithic usePWA.ts with usePWAUpdate.ts (wraps useRegisterSW
  with 60-min periodic checks, offline-ready auto-dismiss) and
  usePWAInstall.ts (browser detection, beforeinstallprompt capture,
  localStorage analytics + dismiss persistence)
- Add InstallPrompt.vue banner — "Install" on Chromium, "How to Install"
  on Safari/Firefox, "Not now" dismiss. Hidden when standalone/dismissed.
- Add InstallInstructionsModal.vue — four browser-specific step-by-step
  guides (Safari iOS, Safari macOS, Firefox Android, Firefox desktop)
  written in plain language for non-technical users
- Add vite-plugin-pwa/client type reference to env.d.ts

Debug:
- Add debugLog.ts — pub/sub event store with 200-entry circular buffer,
  typed sources (boot/db/pwa/import/engine/global) and severities
  (info/success/warn/error). Global error + unhandledrejection listeners
  installed at module load. generateReport() for clipboard export.
- Add DebugPill.vue — floating pill showing entry count + error/warn
  badges. Expanded panel has Log tab (color-coded, auto-scrolling) and
  Environment tab (URL, UA, screen, online, SW support, etc.).
  Copy exports full report, Clear wipes entries.
- Mount DebugPill in separate Vue root (survives main app crashes)
- Alpha-phase only — intended to be removed post-alpha

Tags: pwa, debug, ux, install
Complexity: 4
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: neutral
Epic: pwa
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_01MpkgALaDQ3xJsXyhFZbApL
commits.title: split PWA composables, add install instructions, add debug system

commits.subject: fix(deploy): router base path and SVG font for GitHub Pages
commits.body:
createWebHistory() needs import.meta.env.BASE_URL so vue-router
resolves routes correctly under a sub-path like /budgy-ting/.
SVG icon switched from Georgia (proprietary, absent in CI) to
generic serif so sharp/librsvg renders the B glyph on Ubuntu.

commits.body:
Automated deployment on push to main via actions/deploy-pages.
Icons are regenerated from SVG using sharp for reproducible builds.
Vite base path is set dynamically from configure-pages output so
the PWA works on both project pages and custom domains. SPA routing
handled by copying index.html to 404.html.

commits.subject: feat(mvp): implement full MVP — phases 1-7
commits.body:
Complete implementation of all 7 phases of the budgy-ting product definition:

Phase 1 — Budget Management:
  - BudgetForm (create/edit), BudgetCreateView, BudgetEditView
  - Cascade delete (expenses + actuals), ConfirmDialog component

Phase 2 — Expense Management:
  - ExpenseForm with category autocomplete from IndexedDB
  - ExpensesTab grouped by category, edit/delete per item
  - useCategoryAutocomplete composable

Phase 3 — Projection Engine:
  - Pure TypeScript engine handling all 6 frequency types
  - Partial month and boundary clamping logic
  - ProjectedTab with by-item/by-category toggle

Phase 4 — Import Wizard:
  - CSV parser (RFC 4180), JSON parser, column auto-detection
  - 3-pass matching engine (exact, fuzzy, amount-only)
  - 4-step wizard: upload, map, review/approve, confirm

Phase 5 — Comparison Views:
  - Variance calculation engine
  - Line item, category, monthly views with CSS bar charts
  - Overspend/underspend colour coding with 5% tolerance

Phase 6 — Export/Import:
  - JSON export with comparison snapshot, browser download
  - Restore from backup (replace/merge), schema validation
  - Clear all data with confirmation

Phase 7 — PWA Polish:
  - usePWA composable (install prompt, SW update detection)
  - Install app button in header, update banner

Tags: mvp, vue3, budget, expenses, projection, import, comparison, export, pwa
Complexity: 5
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: added
Epic: mvp-implementation
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_01MpkgALaDQ3xJsXyhFZbApL
commits.title: implement full MVP — phases 1-7

commits.subject: feat(scaffold): Phase 0 — project scaffolding with Vue 3, Vite, TypeScript
commits.body:
Set up the complete project structure for budgy-ting PWA. This establishes the
foundation that all subsequent phases build on: build tooling, routing, database
schema, type definitions, and the app shell UI.

Scaffolding includes:
- Vite + Vue 3 + TypeScript project (package.json, tsconfigs)
- UnoCSS with Tailwind preset, brand colours, utility shortcuts
- vite-plugin-pwa with manifest configuration
- Dexie.js v4 schema v1 (budgets, expenses, actuals, categoryCache)
- TypeScript data models matching product definition
- Vue Router with budget list and budget detail (3 nested tabs)
- AppLayout component (header, max-width content area)
- BudgetListView with empty/loading/list states
- BudgetDetailView with tab navigation
- Stub tab views (Expenses, Projected, Compare)
- Product definition saved to docs/PRODUCT_DEFINITION.md
- Updated README, TODO, SESSION_NOTES, HISTORY, USER_ACTIONS

Tags: scaffolding, vue3, vite, typescript, unocss, pwa, dexie, routing
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 2
Impact: infrastructure
Risk: low
Debt: neutral
Epic: phase-0-scaffolding
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_01MpkgALaDQ3xJsXyhFZbApL
commits.title: Phase 0 — project scaffolding with Vue 3, Vite, TypeScript
